newsitem.title: USA: Quote.com offers 30-day trial, enhances Q-News.
newsitem.headline: Quote.com offers 30-day trial, enhances Q-News.

text.p: Internet financial market information provider Quote.com said it is offering a special 30-day trial for individual investors, including an enhanced version of its Q-News service.
The trial provides market data and research and offers unlimited delayed quotes for U.S. and Canadian exchanges, with end-of-day portfolio updates.
With new features, users can also use a customised news filter to sift through information, with more than 600 topic codes due to be available by the end of the 1997 first quarter, the company said.

Last week, Quote.com unveiled a real-time stock quote capability for 12 markets, including the New York Stock Exchange, the American Stock Exchange, the Nasdaq stock market and the Toronto Stock Exchange along with commodities markets.

The Santa Clara-based company recently linked up with four online trade brokerages -- Charles Schwab, eBroker, E*TRADE and PC Financial Network -- to offer direct access to online trades from Quote.com.
Quote.com is a privately-held company with venture funding from Sequoia Capital Corp of Menlo Park, Calif.
